DataElement.preferredName: New Metastatic Neoplasm First Relapse Anatomic Site Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the new sites of metastatic disease present at first relapse.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before._A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology._The reemergence of a disorder as diagnosed by clinical and/or laboratory evidence following a single documented period of remission.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.:A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.

A tumor that has spread from its original (primary) site of growth to another site, close to or distant from the primary site.  Metastasis is characteristic of advanced malignancies, but in rare instances can be seen in neoplasms lacking malignant morphology.

Property.preferredDefinition: The reemergence of a disorder as diagnosed by clinical and/or laboratory evidence following a single documented period of remission.

Concepts.definition: The reemergence of a disorder as diagnosed by clinical and/or laboratory evidence following a single documented period of remission.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify an anatomic site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was (were) the new sites
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was (were) the new sites of metastatic disease present at first relapse?
